tout.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to praise something or someone in order to persuade people that they are important or worth a lot
tout.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Nell is being touted as the next big thing in Hollywood.
tout.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to try to persuade people to buy goods or services you are offering
tout.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Minicab drivers are not allowed to tout for business.
tout.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to give someone information about a horse in a race
tout.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: someone who buys tickets for a concert, sports match etc and sells them at a higher price, usually on the street near a sports ground, theatre etc
tout.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to try to persuade people to buy goods or services you are offering
tout.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Iâ€™ve been on the phone all morning touting for business.
tout.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: to praise something or someone in order to persuade people that they are worth accepting, using etc
tout.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: She is being touted as the best candidate for the job.
tout.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: someone who buys tickets for a concert, sports match etc and sells them for more than the official price
